gurmukhi: hy kmlwpiq hy grVwDÍj hy jgnwiek kwnH khXo hY ] hy jdubIr kho bqIXw sB hI qumrI BiRq lok BXo hY ]
transliteration: He Kamlaapat(i) He Gadadaa-dhvaj He Jagnaaik Kaahn Kahyo Hai|| He Jadoubeer Kaho Bateeaa Sabh Hitoumribhrit Lok Bhayo Hai||
translation: “O Banner of Garuda ! O Sire of Lakshmi ! and the Lord of the world ! listen to me, Thou art the support of the whole world;”

gurmukhi: morI hro mmqw hir jU ieh BwNq khXo hir cInH lXo hY ] fwr deI mmqw iqh pY soaU monih Dwr kY bYT rihXo hY ]1004]
transliteration: Moridaro Mamtaa Har(i) Joo Eh Bhaant Kahyo Har(i) Cheehn Layo Hai|| Daar Daitih Pai Sooo Monah(i) Dhaar Kai Baith Rahiyo Hai||1004||
translation: Krishna anticipated that Akruru wanted to say something about his deliverance from the attachment and mineness, therefore he effected Akrur’s mineness by granting him the boon through the mind and he himself kept sitting silently.1004.
Speech of Krishna addressed to Akrur:

gurmukhi: AY ho ccw jdubIr kihXo hm kau smJy ibn qY hir cIno ] qw qy lfwvhu moih kihXo ijh qy suK ho Aiq hI muih jIno ]
transliteration: Ai Ho Chachaa Jadoubeer Kahiyo Ham Kau Samjhe Bin Tai Har(i) Cheeno|| Taa Te Ladaavoh Moh(i) Kahiyo Jih Te Soukh Ho At(i) Himuh(i) Jeeno||
translation: “O uncle ! without comprehending me, you have seen me as the manifestation of the Lord; give me the comfort, so that my life may become comfortable;

gurmukhi: Awie smo bsudyvh jI AkRUr bfy lKaU kr kIno ] qw qy nmo GinsXwm lKY ieh Bwq khXo hir jU his dIno ]1005]
transliteration: Ooe Samo Basudevah Jiakroor Bade Lakhaoo Kar Keeno|| Taa Te Namo Ghan(i)syaam Lakhai Eh Bhaat Kahyo Har(i) Joo Has(i) Deeno||1005||
translation: “After Vasudev, you will be considered as the seniormost; I bow before you,” saying thus Krishna smiled.1005.

gurmukhi: so sun bIr pRsMn BXo muslIDr sXwm jU kMT lgwey ] Sok ijqy mn BIqr Qy hir ko qn sBY ibsrwey ]
transliteration: So Soun Beer Prasann Bhayo Mousleedhar Syaam Joo Kanth Lagade|| Shok Jite Man Bheetar The Har(i) Ko Tan Bhet Sabhai Bisraae||
translation: Hearing these words, Akrur was pleased and he hugged both Krishna and Balram; he forsook the sorrow of his mind,

gurmukhi: Cot BqIj lKy kir kY kir kY jg kY krqw nhI pwey ] Xw ibD BI iqh Taur kQw iqh ky kib sXwmih mMgl gwey ]1006]
transliteration: Chhodh Bhateej Lakhe Kar(i) Kai Kar(i) Kai Jag Kai Kartaa Nahipaae|| Yaa Bidh Bhithaur Kathaa Tih Ke Kabi Syaamah(i) Mandal Gade||1006||
translation: And considered the small nephews as merely nephews and not the creator of the world. In this way, this story happened there, which has ben sung by the poet Shyam in praise of Krishna.1006.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI dsm iskMDy bicqR nwtky kiRSnwvqwry AkrUr giH jYby sMpUrnm ]
transliteration: It(i) Sridasam Sikandhe Bachitra Naatake Krishnaavatdare Akroor Grih Jaibe Sanpooranam||
translation: End of the description of “Going to the house of Akrur” in Krishnavatara (based on Dasham Skandh) in Bachittar Natak.

gurmukhi: AQ AkRUr ko PuPI pws Byjn kQnM ]
transliteration: Ath Akroor Ko Phouphipaas Bhejan Kathanan||
translation: Now begins the description of sending Akrur to Aunt

gurmukhi: sRI jdubIr khXo his kY brbIr gjw pur mY cl j`XY ] mo ipq kI BgnI suq hY iqnko Ab jwie kY soDih l`XY ]
transliteration: Srijaoubeer Kahyo Has(i) Kai Barbeer Gadaa Pur Mai Chal Jayyai|| Mo Pit Kibhagnisout Hai Tinko Ab Jaae Kai Sodhah(i) Layyai||
translation: Krishna said smilintly to Akrur, “You go to Hastinapur in order to enquire about the condition of the sons of my father’s sister;
